titles: Extraneus vapulans: or The observator rescued from the violent but vaine assaults of Hamon L'Estrange, Esq. and the back-blows of Dr. Bernard, an Irish-deane. By a well willer to the author of the Observations on the history of the reign of King Charles.
author: Heylyn, Peter, 1600-1662.
publisher: Printed by J.G. for Richard Lowndes at the White Lyon, neere the little north-door of St. Paul's Church.,
notes: The author of the Observations = Peter Heylyn.
A reply to "The observator observ'd" by Hamon L'Estrange and "The life & death of the most reverend and learned father of our Church Dr. James Usher" by Nicholas Bernard.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Bernard, Nicholas, d. 1661. --  Life & death of the most reverend and learned father of our Church Dr. James Usher --  Early works to 1800.
L'Estrange, Hamon, 1605-1660. --  Observator observ'd --  Early works to 1800.
Church of England --  Clergy --  Early works to 1800.
